intro: Disperis nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's disperis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in well-drained environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow with a distinctive lip that attracts pollinators. Disperis nelsonii is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats.
